howItWorks.title: How Depreciation Calculation Works
howItWorks.explanation: Depreciation allocates an asset's cost over its useful life. Straight-line spreads cost evenly each year. Declining balance methods front-load depreciation, providing larger deductions in early years. The method chosen affects tax benefits and financial statements.
steps: Enter the original asset cost (purchase price)
Input the estimated salvage value at end of useful life
Specify the useful life in years
Calculator shows annual depreciation, accumulated depreciation, and book value schedule

seoTips: MACRS is required for US tax depreciation - IRS publishes specific recovery periods
Accelerated methods like double-declining provide larger early deductions
Book depreciation can differ from tax depreciation - track both
Section 179 allows immediate expensing of qualifying assets up to limits
Bonus depreciation may allow 100% first-year deduction for certain assets

commonMistakes.title: Using Wrong Useful Life
commonMistakes.description: IRS specifies depreciation periods for tax purposes. Using arbitrary periods results in incorrect tax deductions.

commonMistakes.title: Forgetting Salvage Value
commonMistakes.description: Assets often retain some value at end of useful life. Depreciating to zero when salvage value exists overstates depreciation.

commonMistakes.title: Mixing Book and Tax Methods
commonMistakes.description: Book depreciation for financial statements may differ from tax depreciation. Track both separately for accurate reporting.

commonMistakes.title: Not Considering Bonus Depreciation
commonMistakes.description: Special tax provisions like Section 179 and bonus depreciation can allow faster write-offs. Consult a tax professional.

faqs.question: What is straight-line depreciation?
faqs.answer: Straight-line spreads depreciation evenly over useful life. Formula: (Cost - Salvage) / Years. Simple but may not reflect actual asset value decline.

faqs.question: When should I use accelerated depreciation?
faqs.answer: When you want larger tax deductions early, or when assets lose value quickly in early years (vehicles, technology). Matches expense to actual value decline.

faqs.question: What is MACRS depreciation?
faqs.answer: Modified Accelerated Cost Recovery System - the US tax method. IRS specifies recovery periods and depreciation rates for different asset classes.

faqs.question: How does depreciation affect taxes?
faqs.answer: Depreciation is a non-cash expense that reduces taxable income. Higher depreciation means lower taxes but also lower reported profit.

faqs.question: Can I depreciate land?
faqs.answer: No. Land doesn't wear out so it cannot be depreciated. Only buildings and improvements on land are depreciable.
